page.title: 16WORK AND TRADE IN CHURCHILL
page.content: Churchill does not possess an industrial site, but there are several small businesses within the area. Mount Farm is converting farm buildings for use by one-man operated trades and crafts such as woodworking, pottery, etc.: in 1985 this is still in its early stages. Established commercial enterprises employing staff are automobile engineers, a building contractor, an equestrian school, a public house and the farms. There are many self-employed people including a landscape gardener, window cleaner, potter, private car hire and courier, general engineer, road haulier, agricultural contractor, carpenter, picture framer and two blacksmiths. Some teachers and school helpers work locally, and there is a paid part-time Parish Clerk. Few people are unemployed.
